text: we've got a bunch of exciting news to
share with you today so let's get
started
google has finally given us everything
we need to know about Google Stadium
including pricing release date and of
course the games that will be available
at launch Google stadia will be
accessible via Google's chromecast ultra
the Chrome browser on PCs and tablets
and the stadia app on the pixel three
phones with plans to expand to more
phones after launch if you'd rather play
on your laptop desktop or tablet open a
Chrome browser window the games will be
controlled via the stadia controller
google says the controller is designed
for streaming games with buttons for
screen shots and accessing the Google
assistant however users will also be
able to use other controllers or a mouse
and keyboard no downloads no patches no
installs just grab your controller and
you're in the stadia controller will
connect directly to Google servers which
will be handling all of the processing
needed to run the game the controllers
will cost $69 and will be available in
three colors clearly white just black
and wasabi the games will be playable in
various formats with Mac specs being 60
frames per second in 4k HDR games
available at launch will include destiny
to Baldur's Gate 3 Mortal Kombat 11 Tom
Clancy's the division 2 Final Fantasy 15
and more that's a look at just some of
the amazing titles were bringing to you
at launch stadia is scheduled to launch
this November however the stadium
founders Edition will be the only way to
play a launch it will cost a hundred and
twenty nine dollars and will include a
limited edition knight blue controller a
chromecast ultra a three month stadia
pro subscription and a three month pass
to give to a friend
we call it the stadia founders Edition
and you can pre-order it starting today
customers who sign up for the founders
Edition can enroll in the stadia pro
plan which will cost $9.99 a month after
the
initial three three months ends it
delivers the best of stadia for just
$9.99 per month 4k HDR
60 frames per second with 5.1 surround
sound access to individual games without
a monthly membership will come in 2020
simply buy the games you want when you
want them we call the stadia base and
any games you purchase they're yours to
play whenever you want customers will be
able to buy and keep games already
available on stadia stadia will be
available in 14 countries at launch
including the US Canada the UK France
and Germany what do you think will you
sign up for stadia at launch is it too
expensive or just right let us know in
